document.docOrigin: Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History 2000 (245)
document.masterDocTitle: A Relimitation And Revision Of The Australasian Ground Spider Family Lamponidae (Araneae: Gnaphosoidea)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Relimitation And Revision Of The Australasian Ground Spider Family Lamponidae (Araneae: Gnaphosoidea)
Bulletin of the American Museum of Natural History

subSubSection.paragraph:
Pseudolampona taroom
, new species Figures 766–769 ; Map 87

TYPE: Male holotype taken in a pitfall trap at Boggomoss , Taroom District , 258259S, 1508019E, Queensland (
Sept. 9–Nov. 11, 1996
; P. Lawless ), deposited in QMB ( S34317 )
.

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 766–769.
Pseudolampona taroom
, new species . 766. Left male palp, ventral view. 767. Same, retrolateral view. 768. Epigynum, ventral view. 769. Same, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: ETYMOLOGY: The specific name is a noun in apposition taken from the type locality.
DIAGNOSIS: Males can be recognized by the distally folded embolus (fig. 766), females by the absence of lateral epigynal margins and the enlarged lobes that separate the spermathecae (fig. 768).

MALE: Total length 2.5. Coloration as in
P. warrandyte
. Retrolateral tibial apophysis relatively long, slightly expanded at about half its length (fig. 767); embolus narrow, folded at about half its length (fig. 766).

FEMALE: Total length 3.1. Coloration as in
P. warrandyte
. Lateral epigynal margins absent, lateral pockets small, often difficult to see (fig. 768); spermathecae separated by enlarged, medially directed lobes (fig. 769).
VARIATION: The two females from New South Wales have relatively short spermathecae, and it is possible that they could prove to represent a different species.

caption.paragraph:
Map 87. Records of
Pseudolampona taroom
, new species (circles) and
P. spurgeon
, new species (squares).

Figs. 770–773.
Pseudolampona spurgeon
, new species . 770. Left male palp, ventral view. 771.
Same, retrolateral view. 772. Epigynum, ventral view. 773. Same, dorsal view.

Figs. 774–777.
Pseudolampona kroombit
, new species . 774. Left male palp, ventral view. 775.
Same, retrolateral view. 776. Epigynum, ventral view. 777. Same, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: DISTRIBUTION: Known only from Queensland and New South Wales (map 87).
